author: Rob Perez
title: Watch Richard Hamilton's Detroit Pistons jersey get retried and raised to the rafters | FOX Sports
text:
Feb 26, 2017 at 8:26p ET 0Shares 
During halftime of the contest between the Detroit Pistons and Boston Celtics on Sunday afternoon, Pistons legend Richard “Rip” Hamilton was honored with a special jersey retirement ceremony. 
After words by legendary Fox Sports Detroit announcer George Blaha and former teammate Chauncey Billups, Hamilton took the mic. "You made me better every day … you made us champions"– Chauncey to Rip. #Yessir pic.twitter.com/mUrbeRi0YK 
— Detroit Pistons (@DetroitPistons) February 27, 2017 
With his former high school head coach, former UCONN coach Jim Calhoun, former Pistons coach Larry Brown, and former running mates Tayshaun Prince, Rasheed Wallace, and Ben Wallace in attendance — Hamilton then took the mic for a few words: 
— Detroit Pistons (@DetroitPistons) February 27, 2017 Rip says his Dad believed in him more than he believed in himself. Special moment. Papa Hamilton fighting back tears. 
— Jake Chapman (@JakeChapmanNBA) February 27, 2017 
And then it was time for the jersey retirement: up to The Palace of Auburn Hills rafters #32 went forever. Rip's jersey to the rafters! #Yessir pic.twitter.com/8ENVj9W2Tj 
— Detroit Pistons (@DetroitPistons) February 27, 2017 
Before the ceremony began, Hamilton was honored with a special tribute video from the Pistons franchise: MUST WATCH: Watch #Pistons Hits dedicated to the distinguished career of our beloved number 32, @RipCityHamilton . #Yessir pic.twitter.com/mEGJ93KMnb 
— Detroit Pistons (@DetroitPistons) February 27, 2017 
As Blaha alluded to at the beginning of his speech, no Detroit Pistons player scored more points in the playoffs, made more playoff field goals, or played in more playoff games than Richard Hamilton. A well-deserved honor for one of Detroit basketball’s greats. 0
